revised_title: Observations on the Dragonfly Life Cycle and Reproduction in Pennsylvania
tldr: This article describes the life cycle and reproduction of the dragonfly in Pennsylvania. It discusses the development of the dragonfly from its deformed water-insect stage to its final, beautiful flying form. The author also explains the mating habits of the dragonfly, which involves a unique impregnation process. The article highlights the differences between the American and European dragonfly species and the variety of dragonflies found in both continents.
